comment_data.body: I decided to not modify this group after all. Docs and tests rely on this name and it seems to come from vim.

comment_regular_data.body: Whoops, sorry if I was not clear. Shouldn't that also be included in this PR, and changed to "nvim.shadacommands" or "nvim.shada"? Or does that only work with with augroups defined in lua code?

> Whoops, sorry if I was not clear. Shouldn't that also be included in this PR, and changed to "nvim.shadacommands" or "nvim.shada"? Or does that only work with with augroups defined in lua code?

I think that @justinmk's original suggestion was limited to the names we create via `nvim_create_augroup` and `nvim_create_namespace` (in Lua). I think it would be weird to rename this pascal-cased vim names, but I'll let others weigh in.

Personally I don't think whether a group is created in vimscript or Lua should have any weight on the name of that group. What I think is more important is that all the groups created by core have a consistent naming scheme.

This gets a bit fuzzy when you consider the groups from vim, but we can make those an exception.

> What I think is more important is that all the groups created by core have a consistent naming scheme.

Agreed, but let's ignore vimscript / legacy vim augroup names for now, to unblock this PR, since it sets a pattern for Lua, where most activity is happening anyway.

Some tests are failing, just need to update them then let's merge this.

> Agreed, but let's ignore vimscript / legacy vim augroup names for now, to unblock this PR, since it sets a pattern for Lua, where most activity is happening anyway.
> 
> Some tests are failing, just need to update them then let's merge this.

Yep yep, pardon my skill issues. Will get to it after work today :)

idk why but [this line](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/611ef354919f1c6564efd2ff8074545941458ccc/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua#L163) fails (with an 'invalid group' error) if I change the autocommand name to `nvim.syntaxset` (and update both line 144 and 163). Leaving it as is for now.
<s>Okay help wanted to figure out why the old tests are still failing</s> nvm I figured it out.

> but [this line](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/611ef354919f1c6564efd2ff8074545941458ccc/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua#L163) fails (with an 'invalid group' error) if I change the autocommand name to `nvim.syntaxset` (and update both line 144 and 163). Leaving it as is for now.

👍 that's a legacy augroup defined here (and elsewhere): https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/47866cd8d20c62afa8a3c3929d3aada2db9162f5/runtime/syntax/manual.vim#L22
